title: 104_hr3533
content: The Act may be cited as the "ATM Public Safety and Crime Control Act of 1996" and requires enhanced security measures at depository institutions. The Bank Protection Act of 1968 is amended to include enhanced surveillance requirements for depository institutions, based on FBI recommendations. This includes maintaining quality surveillance cameras for criminal prosecution evidence and operating them effectively. The Bank Protection Act of 1968 is amended to include enhanced surveillance requirements for depository institutions, such as operating cameras effectively to maintain quality surveillance pictures. The Bank Protection Act of 1968 is amended to include enhanced surveillance requirements for depository institutions, such as operating cameras effectively to maintain quality surveillance pictures. Additionally, Section 3 of the Act calls for a study and technical recommendations by the FBI. The Bank Protection Act of 1968 is amended to include enhanced surveillance requirements for depository institutions, with the FBI tasked to periodically review security standards and consult with the Attorney General for effective crime prevention measures. The FBI will consult with the Attorney General to assess how security issues at financial institutions have impacted prosecutions. The Director of the FBI will provide technical recommendations to banking agencies on security standards. The FBI Director will also report recommendations to the Judiciary Committees. The FBI will provide security recommendations to banking agencies and report them to the Judiciary Committees of the House of Representatives and the Senate. A clerical amendment will be made to the table of sections for chapter 33 of title 28, United States Code. The Federal banking agencies must finalize regulations based on FBI recommendations within 6 months. Depository institutions must comply with these regulations within 6 months of publication in the Federal Register. Amendments to definitions in the Bank Protection Act of 1968 are also proposed. The Act defines "depository institution" and "Federal supervisory agency" according to the Federal Deposit Insurance Act.
